column5: Enjoy
Kewl vid Kev.  Cheers, Ron...
yup, real cool
Nice video. Always like the under ice view
Very nice, thanks
Great vid. Love the underwater footage.  Thanks!
nice video thanks for posting.   Art
haha love watching them get plucked from the school like they are being beamed up into space!
Thx for sharing. Loved it.
Nice. Love it.

Fantastic, keep up the good work. Great production values, and not a single Rappala, Canadian Tire or Cooper tire commercial to be found!  I think I saw one fish have the jig bounce off it's noggin a few times, cool. There sure are a few fish down there. Did you use the camera to find that hot spot or are you just that good, or lucky?
great underwater view and LOVE the express elevator ride to the penthouse for the unlucky perch lol
Nice video. Perch fishing is fun when they're biting like that.  Crazy to think, for southern Ontario anyway, we've already had a 2 month ice fishing season.

That was so sweet.  Didnt get to watch til I got home. Funny how the rest of the pack dosent even flicker,when you yank one of them out of the pack.  I do like the pan heater thing you got rigged over the burner. Care to share a pic of it? I love my over stuffed ravies..
Great video thanks
Great video,I see no shortage of Perch any time soon lol..They have to be the rabbits of the fish world !!
Thanks all.  Forgot to mention to watch it in HD!  I guess the fish were just everywhere

Brian,  it's the heater itself.  This one I didn't have to add mods.  I just had to turn it facing up so I have a surface to cook/reheat my food.  I think my heater is called a Coleman BlackCat Catalytic heater.
. Looked like a burner under a flat pan in the vid..  Thanks Kevin
Those vids were great. There used to be another member who used to put up great underwater perch videos.  What was his name... Brian, do you remember who...
Nice video, looks like you had lots of fun as well.
Great vid!
The underwater footage was with your gopro right? How did u rig it? Did you weight it underneath to keep the cam steady? Thx!
Hey Chris, it was with a go pro. It was attached to a tripod that was weighed down and got sent down the hole.
Great Video!
